intro: Amberboa abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian amberboa, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its erect stems, narrow leaves, and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
